terms.definition: The RootServer application that owns runtime boot, DI wiring, shared services, and module/plugin discovery.
A cohesive capability package intended to be always-active within the Host and directly referenceable by other modules.
An extension unit that can reference Modules and Host surfaces, but the Host should not take a compile-time dependency on plugins.
Primary UI hierarchy source folder containing Pages/Layouts/Components/Sections/Nav.
Numbered micro→macro folder convention used in Shared/_Core and Shared/_Editor (e.g., 00_Core, 02_Fields, 09_Panels).
Component filename prefixes indicating role (e.g., F_ for Fields, P_ for Pointers, A_ for Actions).
Vertical data model used in the Airtable integration: Base contains Tables; Tables contain Rows; Rows contain Fields.
